II. ALLEGATION(S)

III. METHODOLOGY

ALLEGATION:
On 06/04/2021, when Youth A got home from school Staff 1 told Youth A, he needed to
check his pockets and backpack. Youth A refused to allow Staff 1 to search his pockets and
backpack. Youth A went outside, and Staff 1 followed him. While outside Staff 1 roughed
Youth A up and pushed him. Youth A was not injured. Youth A is not afraid of Staff 1 but is
mad at him. A safety plan was put in place and Youth A will not engage with Staff 1.
2

INVESTIGATION:
I spoke with Administrator 1 on the phone on 6/7/21. She indicated that Youth A
was at school but would be back at the facility in the early afternoon each day.
I interviewed Youth A in person at the facility on 6/9/21. He began the interview
by stating “the allegations are what happened”. He reported Staff 1 told him he will
check his pockets “the hard way or easy way” but he is going to check his pockets.
He also reported he left the building to talk to another youth outside and was
followed by Staff 1. He reported having nothing in his pockets but as he told the
story, he reported Staff 1 found a popsicle and juice box in his pockets. He reported
wearing a hoodie and having these items in the pouch of the hoodie. He reported
telling Staff 2 he was assaulted by Staff 1 and having Staff 2 tell him he was not
assaulted. He also reported telling Staff 2 this on 6/8/21. He reported being pushed
to the ground by Staff 1 after he checked his pockets and having Youth B witness
the entire incident. He ended by stating he “feels safe here”.
I interviewed Youth B in person at the facility on 6/9/21. He reported being a
witness to the incident described in the allegations and stated the events occurred
just as described. He reported being present but amended his report to being inside
of the facility and observing the incident through a window (approximately 60 feet
away). He reported the following.
It looked like Staff 1 tried to grab something out of his sweater and then pushed
his to the ground. He pushed him from the front, and he fell to the ground on his
back. I didn’t know what was going on between them.
He reported youth are checked for items when they return to campus and if a youth
refused to cooperate, they will experience a consequence. He reported the
consequence will be the loss of television time or something else. He reported
feeling safe at the facility.
I interviewed Administrator 1 in person at the facility on 6/9/21. She reported not
being aware of the allegations but receiving information from Youth A’s therapist
about him wanting to get Staff 1 fired. She denied having knowledge of a safety plan
because she didn’t know of the allegations.
I interviewed Staff 1 in person at the facility on 6/9/21. He reported remembering
the incident but denied the allegations occurred as reported. He reported the facility
has a process of checking all youth returning to campus for items they are not
allowed to possess. He also reported Youth A was the only youth who took
exception to having to be checked and he reported he is often caught with food he is
trying to sneak into his room. He reported food is not allowed in the bedroom for
sanitary reasons. He reported Youth C was outside at the time and Youth A went
outside which is against the rule of only one youth outside at a time. He reported
Youth A “had a hoodie draped over his neck but was not really wearing the hoodie”.
He reported reaching into the pouch of the hoodie and finding the popsicle and juice
3

box. He also reported denying he pushed Youth A, or that Youth A fell to the ground.
He reported Youth A grabbed his hand when he grabbed the food items but let go
when he told him to let go. He reported never touching Youth A and having a
witness within a couple of feet during the exchange. He identified the witness as
Youth C.
I interviewed Youth C in person at the facility on 6/9/21. She reported being
present during the incident between Staff 1 and Youth A. She reported “Youth A was
not supposed to be outside because only one youth at a time can be outside and
Staff 1 came outside because of this”. She reported, “Staff 1 told Youth A he knew
he had food and he needed to give it to him so he can put it into his box. Youth A
refused to give up the food.” She gave the same report about the hoodie being
wrapped around Youth A and Staff 1 reaching into the pouch to get the food items.
She denied Staff 1 pushed Youth A to the ground or he had any physical contact
with Youth A. She reported observing nothing inappropriate but observing Youth A
just not wanting to follow the rules. She reported feeling safe at the facility.
I interviewed Therapist 1 in person at the facility on 6/9/21. She reported Youth
A was “very upset” with Staff 1 during a therapy session on June 3, 2021, because
“Staff 1 is reported by Youth A to give him consequences for things”. She reported
Youth A stated, “he wanted Staff 1 to get fired or die a slow and painful death”. She
was asked about Youth B and reported “he likes to be involved in things and wants
to be liked by his peers”.
I interviewed Staff 2 by phone on 6/11/21. She reported being told by Youth A
Staff 1 assaulted him, but she also reported knowing of the allegations prior to being
told by Youth A. She reported Youth A was upset because “Staff 1 believed he had
candy in her pockets”. She reported asking Youth A if the shove was hard and Youth
A responded it was. She also reported no other information was provided by Youth
A.
Documents Reviewed
I received the following email from the Case Worker on 6/29/21.
I do not have any other additional information. Youth A was consistent in the
story that I reported when I went to visit him. Youth A has stated multiple times
that he does not like this staff member and did not like him when this incident
occurred.
I reviewed information from the Human Resources file of Staff 1. Documentation
indicates he is current on all training including behavior management techniques.
Documentation also indicates the only disciplinary action with Staff 1 took place on
3/28/2019 in the form of a verbal warning. This action was taken because he needed
to “attend staff meetings and keep up to date on own training”. Evaluations since
that time have been identified as “outstanding”.
4

I reviewed the therapy note for the individual session that took place on 6/3/21.
Within the note it is documented Youth A was very upset and frustrated with “first
shift staff and reported ‘wanting them to be fired’ and wished them slow and painful
deaths. It is documented Youth A reported receiving consequences for nothing and
will not follow the rules ‘until you guys start treating me like an adult is when I will
start acting like one’. The conclusion of the therapist is Youth A engaged in flawed
thinking patterns and tends to blame others for his actions.
I reviewed the daily progress note for Youth A dated 6/4/21 for the first shift. This
note outlines the treatment goals and staff’s interventions for each day. His overall
behaviors are also documented and state the following.
After returning home from the last day of school Youth A again was gamey about
trying to hide food Youth A brought home from school. Youth A gave some to be
put in his box, but staff could see other food. Staff ended up confiscating the
contraband.
I reviewed the current Treatment Plan for Youth A. This document covers 3/6/21 to
5/24/21 and addresses the presenting problems with the identified treatment goals.
All social work contacts and therapy (individual and group) sessions are identified
within the report, and he is receiving services daily and weekly. The aftercare plan is
outlined.
I reviewed the document titled “Standard Operating Procedures: Contraband
Checks”. This document outlines the process staff are to use when checking a
youth’s room to ensure that items considered contraband are removed. These
contraband checks are to occur during first and second shift.
I reviewed the document titled “YIELD” which addresses the behavioral responsibility
of youth. This document states that youth are not to have food in their rooms and all
food items must be stored within their “bin in the office”.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall
include all of the
following:
(a) A structured system designed to reward the positive
behavior of individual residents based upon the effort put
forth.
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management,
and social skills.
5

ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews and written
documentation do not support the allegations of staff
mishandling Youth A. Staff 1 and Youth C both report being
present, and both deny the allegations. Youth B reported being
a witness but was looking outside from inside the facility
approximately sixty feet away. He acknowledges not knowing
what was occurring at the time. Evidence presented suggests
that Youth A has a “hidden agenda” in wanting to get Staff 1
fired and may have fabricated the allegations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that this investigation be closed with no change made to the
license of this Child Caring Institution

sir_summary.summary: An investigation was conducted into allegations that a staff member at Maple Lodge Group Home roughed up and pushed a youth (Youth A) during a contraband check. The report concludes that the allegations were not substantiated, as statements from the accused staff member (Staff 1) and a witness youth (Youth C) contradicted the account, and evidence suggested Youth A had a pre-existing grudge and motive to get Staff 1 fired. Ultimately, the state found no policy violations occurred during the incident.
